group.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to whole system (all servers).

function.name: bookmarks
function.description: Read bookmarks using the specified parameters.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: startTime
param.description: Start time of the interval with bookmarks (in milliseconds since epoch). Default value is 0. Should be less than endTime.

param.name: endTime
param.description: End time of the interval with bookmarks (in milliseconds since epoch). Default value is the current time. Should be greater than startTime.

param.name: sortBy
param.description: Field to sort the results by. Default value is "startTime".

param.name: sortOrder
param.description: Sort order. Default order is ascending.

param.name: limit
param.description: Maximum number of bookmarks to return. Unlimited by default.

param.name: filter
param.description: Text-search filter string.

param.name: local
param.description: If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

param.name: extraFormatting
param.description: If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

function.name: bookmarks/add
function.description: Add a bookmark to the target server.

param.name: guid
param.description: Identifier of the bookmark.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: name
param.description: Caption of the bookmark.

param.name: description
param.description: Details of the bookmark.

param.name: timeout
param.description: Time during which the recorded period should be preserved (in milliseconds).

param.name: startTime
param.description: Start time of the bookmark (in milliseconds since epoch).

param.name: duration
param.description: Length of the bookmark (in milliseconds).

param.name: tag
param.description: Applied tag. Several tag parameters could be used to specify multiple tags.

param.name: local
param.description: If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

param.name: extraFormatting
param.description: If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

param.name: guid

param.name: local

param.name: extraFormatting
param.description: If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

param.name: format

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: name
param.description: Caption of the bookmark.

param.name: description

function.name: cameraThumbnail
function.description: Get the static image from the camera.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: time
param.description: Timestamp of the requested image (in milliseconds since epoch). The special value "latest", which is the default value, requires to retrieve the latest thumbnail. The special value "now" requires to retrieve the thumbnail corresponding to the current time.

param.name: rotate
param.description: Image orientation. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent or equals -1, the image will be rotated as defined in the camera settings.

param.name: height
param.description: Desired image height. Should be not less than 128, or equal to -1 (the default value) which implies the original frame size, and in this case the width should also be omitted or set to -1.

param.name: width
param.description: Desired image width. Should be not less than 128, or equal to -1 (the default value) which implies autosizing: if the height is specified, the width will be calculated based on the aspect ratio, otherwise, the original frame size will be used.

param.name: imageFormat
param.description: Format of the requested image. Default value is "JpgFormat".

value.name: raw
value.description: Raw video frame. Makes the request much more lightweight for Edge servers.

param.name: roundMethod
param.description: Getting a thumbnail at the exact timestamp is costly, so, it can be rounded to the nearest keyframe, thus, the default value is "KeyFrameAfterMethod".

value.name: before
value.description: Get the thumbnail from the nearest keyframe before the given time.

value.name: precise
value.description: Get the thumbnail as near to given time as possible.

value.name: after
value.description: Get the thumbnail from the nearest keyframe after the given time.

param.name: aspectRatio
param.description: Allows to avoid scaling the image to the aspect ratio from camera settings.

value.name: auto
value.description: Default value. Use aspect ratio from camera settings (if any).

value.name: source
value.description: Use the source frame aspect ratio, despite the value in camera settings.

param.name: local
param.description: If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

param.name: extraFormatting
param.description: If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

function.name: execAction
function.description: Execute an action. Action data should be in the internal binary format. This method is going to be refactored in next versions.

result.caption: XML with the "OK" message or an error code.

function.name: getCameraHistoryItems
function.description: Read information about which server was hosting the camera at which period. This information is used for archive playback if camera has been moved from one server to another.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

result.caption: List of camera history items in the requested format.

function.name: getCameraUserAttributesList
function.description: Read additional camera attributes.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

param.name: id
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id", "physicalId" or "logicalId" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). If omitted, return data for all cameras.

result.caption: List of objects with additional camera attributes for all cameras, in the requested format.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera unique id.

param.name: cameraName
param.description: Camera name.

param.name: userDefinedGroupName
param.description: Name of the user-defined camera group.

param.name: scheduleEnabled
param.description: Whether recording to the archive is enabled for the camera.

param.name: licenseUsed
param.description: Whether the license is used for the camera.

param.name: motionType
param.description: Type of motion detection method.

value.name: MT_HardwareGrid
value.description: Use motion detection grid implemented by the camera.

value.name: MT_SoftwareGrid
value.description: Use motion detection grid implemented by the server.

value.name: MT_MotionWindow
value.description: Use motion detection window implemented by the camera.

param.name: motionMask
param.description: List of motion detection areas and their sensitivity. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions. Currently, this string defines several rectangles separated with ":", each rectangle is described by 5 comma-separated numbers: sensitivity, x and y (for left top corner), width, height.

param.name: scheduleTasks
param.description: List of scheduleTask objects which define the camera recording schedule.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].startTime
param.description: Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

param.name: scheduleTasks[].endTime
param.description: Time of day when the backup ends (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

param.name: scheduleTasks[].recordAudio
param.description: Whether to record sound.

value.name: RT_MotionOnly
value.description: Record only when the motion is detected.

value.name: RT_MotionAndLowQuality
value.description: Always record low quality stream, and record high quality stream on motion.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].dayOfWeek
param.description: Weekday for the recording task.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].beforeThreshold
param.description: The number of seconds before a motion event to record the video for.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].afterThreshold
param.description: The number of seconds after a motion event to record the video for.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].streamQuality
param.description: Quality of the recording.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].fps
param.description: Frames per second (integer).

param.name: audioEnabled
param.description: Whether audio is enabled on the camera.

value.name: true
value.description: enable dual streaming if it supported by camera.

param.name: controlEnabled
param.description: Whether server manages the camera (changes resolution, FPS, create profiles, etc).

param.name: dewarpingParams
param.description: Image dewarping parameters. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

param.name: minArchiveDays
param.description: Minimum number of days to keep the archive for. If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

param.name: maxArchiveDays
param.description: Maximum number of days to keep the archive for. If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

param.name: preferredServerId
param.description: Unique id of a server which has the highest priority of hosting the camera for failover (if the current server fails).

param.name: failoverPriority
param.description: Priority for the camera to be moved to another server for failover (if the current server fails).

value.name: FP_Never
value.description: Will never be moved to another server.

param.name: backupType
param.description: Combination (via "|") of the flags defining backup options.

value.name: CameraBackup_Default
value.description: A default value is used for backup options.

function.name: getCamerasEx
function.description: Read camera list.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

param.name: id
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id", "physicalId" or "logicalId" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). If omitted, return data for all cameras.

result.caption: List of camera information objects in the requested format.

param.name: id
param.description: Camera unique id.

param.name: parentId
param.description: Unique id of the server hosting the camera.

param.name: name
param.description: Camera name.

param.name: url
param.description: Camera IP address, or a complete HTTP URL if the camera was added manually. Also, for multichannel encoders a complete URL is always used.

param.name: typeId
param.description: Unique id of the camera type. A camera type can describe predefined information such as camera maximum resolution, FPS, etc. Detailed type information can be obtained via GET /ec2/getResourceTypes request.

param.name: mac
param.description: Camera MAC address.

param.name: physicalId
param.description: Camera unique identifier. This identifier can used in some requests related to a camera.

param.name: manuallyAdded
param.description: Whether the user added the camera manually.

param.name: model
param.description: Camera model.

param.name: groupId
param.description: Internal group identifier. It is used for grouping channels of multi-channel cameras together.

param.name: groupName
param.description: Group name. This name can be changed by users.

param.name: statusFlags
param.description: Usually this field is zero. Non-zero value indicates that the camera is causing a lot of network issues.

param.name: vendor
param.description: Camera manufacturer.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera unique id. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

param.name: cameraName
param.description: Camera name.

param.name: userDefinedGroupName
param.description: Name of the user-defined camera group.

param.name: scheduleEnabled
param.description: Whether recording to the archive is enabled for the camera.

param.name: licenseUsed
param.description: Whether the license is used for the camera.

param.name: motionType
param.description: Type of motion detection method.

value.name: MT_HardwareGrid
value.description: Use motion detection grid implemented by the camera.

value.name: MT_SoftwareGrid
value.description: Use motion detection grid implemented by the server.

value.name: MT_MotionWindow
value.description: Use motion detection window implemented by the camera.

param.name: motionMask
param.description: List of motion detection areas and their sensitivity. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions. Currently, this string defines several rectangles separated with ":", each rectangle is described by 5 comma-separated numbers: sensitivity, x and y (for the left top corner), width, height.

param.name: scheduleTasks
param.description: List of scheduleTask objects which define the camera recording schedule.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].startTime
param.description: Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

param.name: scheduleTasks[].endTime
param.description: Time of day when the backup ends (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

param.name: scheduleTasks[].recordAudio
param.description: Whether to record sound.

value.name: RT_MotionOnly
value.description: Record only when the motion is detected.

value.name: RT_MotionAndLowQuality
value.description: Always record low quality stream, and record high quality stream on motion.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].dayOfWeek
param.description: Day of week for the recording task.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].beforeThreshold
param.description: The number of seconds before a motion event to record the video for.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].afterThreshold
param.description: The number of seconds after a motion event to record the video for.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].streamQuality
param.description: Quality of the recording.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].fps
param.description: Frames per second (integer).

param.name: audioEnabled
param.description: Whether audio is enabled on the camera.

value.name: true
value.description: enable dual streaming if it supported by camera.

param.name: controlEnabled
param.description: Whether server manages the camera (changes resolution, FPS, create profiles, etc).

param.name: dewarpingParams
param.description: Image dewarping parameters. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

param.name: minArchiveDays
param.description: Minimum number of days to keep the archive for. If the value is less than or equal to zero, it is not used.

param.name: maxArchiveDays
param.description: Maximum number of days to keep the archive for. If the value is less than or equal to zero, it is not used.

param.name: preferredServerId
param.description: Unique id of a server which has the highest priority of hosting the camera for failover (if the current server fails).

param.name: failoverPriority
param.description: Priority for the camera to be moved to another server for failover (if the current server fails).

value.name: FP_Never
value.description: Will never be moved to another server.

param.name: backupType
param.description: Combination (via "|") of the flags defining backup options.

value.name: CameraBackup_Default
value.description: A default value is used for backup options.

param.name: status
param.description: Camera status.

param.name: addParams
param.description: List of additional parameters for the camera. This list can contain such information as full ONVIF URL, camera maximum FPS, etc.

function.name: getEventRules
function.description: Return all event rules.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

param.name: id
param.description: Event rule unique id. If omitted, return data for all event rules.

result.caption: List of event rule objects in the requested format.

param.name: id
param.description: Event rule unique id.

param.name: eventType
param.description: One of the fixed values.

value.name: cameraMotionEvent
value.description: Motion has occurred on a camera.

value.name: networkIssueEvent
value.description: Network issue: packet lost, RTP timeout, etc.

value.name: cameraIpConflictEvent
value.description: Found some cameras with same IP address.

value.name: serverConflictEvent
value.description: Two or more servers are running.

value.name: userDefinedEvent
value.description: Custom event defined by the user.

param.name: eventResourceIds
param.description: List of event resource ids.

param.name: eventCondition
param.description: String containing a JSON object, some fields of which depend on eventType. Defines the filter for an event to make the rule applicable. NOTE: Other fields than the described below can be stored in this object, but they are not used for event matching.

param.name: eventCondition.resourceName
param.description: Substring to be found in the name of the resource (e.g. a camera) which caused the event. Empty string matches any value.

param.name: eventCondition.inputPortId
param.description: (string) Used for input events only. Empty string matches any value.

param.name: eventCondition.caption
param.description: Substring to be found in the short event description. Empty string matches any value.

param.name: eventCondition.description
param.description: Substring to be found in the long event description. Empty string matches any value.

param.name: eventState
param.description: One of the fixed values.

value.name: undefined
value.description: Also used in event rule to associate non-toggle action with event with any toggle state.

param.name: actionType
param.description: Type of the action. The object fields in actionParams field depend on this value, as shown in particular values description.

value.name: cameraOutputAction
value.description: Change camera output state. actionParams: - relayOutputID (string, required) - Id of output to trigger. - durationMs (uint, optional) - Timeout (in milliseconds) to reset the camera state back.

value.name: sendMailAction
value.description: Send an email. This action can be executed from any endpoint. actionParams: - emailAddress (string, required)

value.name: diagnosticsAction
value.description: Write a record to the server log.

value.name: playSoundAction
value.description: actionParams: - url (string, required) - Url of the sound, contains path to the sound on the server.

value.name: playSoundOnceAction
value.description: actionParams: - url (string, required) - Url of the sound, contains path to the sound on the server.

value.name: sayTextAction
value.description: actionParams: - sayText (string, required) - Text that will be provided to TTS engine.

value.name: executePtzPresetAction
value.description: Execute given PTZ preset. actionParams: - resourceId - presetId

value.name: showTextOverlayAction
value.description: Show text overlay over the given camera(s). actionParams: - text (string, required) - Text that will be displayed.

value.name: showOnAlarmLayoutAction
value.description: Put the given camera(s) to the Alarm Layout. actionParams: - users - List of users which will receive this alarm notification.

value.name: execHttpRequestAction
value.description: Send HTTP request as an action. actionParams: - url - Full HTTP url to execute. Username/password are stored as part of the URL. - text - HTTP message body for POST method.

param.name: actionResourceIds
param.description: List of action resource ids.

param.name: actionParams
param.description: String containing a JSON object which fields depend on actionType and thus are described next to the respective actionType values.

param.name: aggregationPeriod
param.description: Period (in seconds) during which the consecutive similar events are aggregated into a single event.

param.name: disabled
param.description: Whether the rule is disabled.

param.name: comment
param.description: An arbitrary comment to the rule.

param.name: schedule
param.description: String containing a lower-case hex array of 21 bytes, which is a bit mask for a week (starting on Monday), where each consecutive bit corresponds to an hour and equals 1 for "enabled" and 0 for "disabled". Thus, the first byte describes the first 8 hours of Monday after midnight, and the last byte describes the last 8 hours of Sunday before midnight; in a byte, the highest significant bit corresponds to the earliest hour. Example: Enable all hours in a week except for the Monday interval from 7am to 9am: fe7fffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff

param.name: system
param.description: Whether the rule is a built-in one, which cannot be deleted.

function.name: recordedTimePeriods
function.description: Return the recorded chunks info for the specified cameras.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). This parameter can be used several times to define a list of cameras.

param.name: startTime
param.description: Start time of the interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

param.name: endTime
param.description: End time of the interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

param.name: filter
param.description:
This parameter is used for motion search ("periodsType" must be 1). Match motion on a video by specified rectangle.
Format: string with a JSON list of sensors, each sensor is a JSON list of rects, each rect is:
{"x": x, "y": y, "width": width,"height": height}
All values are measured in relative portions of a video frame, x and width in range [0..43], y and height in range [0..31], zero is the left-top corner.
Example of a full-frame rectangle for a single-sensor camera: [[{"x":0,"y":0,"width":43,"height":31}]]
Example of two rectangles for a single-sensor camera: [[{"x":0,"y":0,"width":5,"height":7},{"x":12,"y":10,"width":8,"height":6}]]

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

param.name: detail
param.description: Chunk detail level, in microseconds. Time periods that are shorter than the detail level are discarded. You can treat the detail level as the amount of microseconds per screen pixel.

param.name: periodsType
param.description: Chunk type.

value.description: Only chunks with motion (parameter "filter" is required).

param.name: keepSmallChunks
param.description: If specified, standalone chunks smaller than the detail level are not removed from the result.

param.name: limit
param.description: Maximum number of chunks to return.

param.name: flat
param.description: If specified, do not group chunk lists by server.

result.caption:
JSON object with an error code, error message and the list of JSON objects in "reply" field: if no "flat" parameter is specified, "reply" field is the list which contains for each server its GUID (as "guid" field) and the list of chunks (as "periods" field); if "flat" parameter is specified, "reply" field is just the list of chunks.
Each chunk is a pair of (durationMs, startTimeMs). Chunks are merged for all requested cameras. Start time and duration are in milliseconds since epoch. Duration of -1 means the last chunk is being recorded now.

function.name: saveCameraUserAttributes
function.description:
Save additional camera attributes for a single camera.
Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.
function.permissions: Administrator, or a custom user with "Edit camera settings" permission.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera unique id. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

param.name: cameraName
param.description: Camera name.

param.name: userDefinedGroupName
param.description: Name of the user-defined camera group.

param.name: scheduleEnabled
param.description: Whether recording to the archive is enabled for the camera.

param.name: licenseUsed
param.description: Whether the license is used for the camera.

param.name: motionType
param.description: Type of motion detection method.

value.name: MT_HardwareGrid
value.description: Use motion detection grid implemented by the camera.

value.name: MT_SoftwareGrid
value.description: Use motion detection grid implemented by the server.

value.name: MT_MotionWindow
value.description: Use motion detection window implemented by the camera.

param.name: motionMask
param.description: List of motion detection areas and their sensitivity. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions. Currently, this string defines several rectangles separated with ":", each rectangle is described by 5 comma-separated numbers: sensitivity, x and y (for left top corner), width, height.

param.name: scheduleTasks
param.description: List of scheduleTask objects which define the camera recording schedule.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].startTime
param.description: Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

param.name: scheduleTasks[].endTime
param.description: Time of day when the backup ends (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

param.name: scheduleTasks[].recordAudio
param.description: Whether to record sound.

value.name: RT_MotionOnly
value.description: Record only when the motion is detected.

value.name: RT_MotionAndLowQuality
value.description: Always record low quality stream, and record high quality stream on motion.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].dayOfWeek
param.description: Weekday for the recording task.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].beforeThreshold
param.description: The number of seconds before a motion event to record the video for.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].afterThreshold
param.description: The number of seconds after a motion event to record the video for.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].streamQuality
param.description: Quality of the recording.

param.name: scheduleTasks[].fps
param.description: Frames per second (integer).

param.name: audioEnabled
param.description: Whether audio is enabled on the camera.

value.name: true
value.description: enable dual streaming if it supported by camera.

param.name: controlEnabled
param.description: Whether server manages the camera (changes resolution, FPS, create profiles, etc).

param.name: dewarpingParams
param.description: Image dewarping parameters. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

param.name: minArchiveDays
param.description: Minimum number of days to keep the archive for. If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

param.name: maxArchiveDays
param.description: Maximum number of days to keep the archive for. If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

param.name: preferredServerId
param.description: Unique id of a server which has the highest priority of hosting the camera for failover (if the current server fails).

param.name: failoverPriority
param.description: Priority for the camera to be moved to another server for failover (if the current server fails).

value.name: FP_Never
value.description: Will never be moved to another server.

param.name: backupType
param.description: Combination (via "|") of the flags defining backup options.

value.name: CameraBackup_Default
value.description: A default value is used for backup options.

function.name: saveLayout
function.description:
Save layout.
Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.
function.permissions: Administrator, or a user who owns the layout.

param.name: id
param.description: Layout unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

param.name: parentId
param.description: Unique id of the user owning the layout.

param.name: name
param.description: Layout name.

param.name: url
param.description: Should be empty string.

param.name: typeId
param.description: Should have fixed value.

param.name: cellAspectRatio
param.description: Aspect ratio of a cell for layout items (floating-point).

param.name: horizontalSpacing
param.description: Horizontal spacing between layout items (floating-point).

param.name: verticalSpacing
param.description: Vertical spacing between layout items (floating-point).

param.name: items
param.description: List of the layout items.

param.name: items[].id
param.description: Item unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object.

param.name: items[].flags
param.description: Should have fixed value.

param.name: items[].left
param.description: Left coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

param.name: items[].top
param.description: Top coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

param.name: items[].right
param.description: Right coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

param.name: items[].bottom
param.description: Bottom coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

param.name: items[].rotation
param.description: Degree of image tilt; a positive value rotates counter-clockwise (floating-point, 0..360).

param.name: items[].resourceId
param.description: Camera unique id.

param.name: items[].resourcePath
param.description: If the item represents a local file - URL of the file, otherwise is empty.

param.name: items[].zoomLeft
param.description: Left coordinate of the displayed window inside the camera image, as a fraction of the image width (floating-point, 0..1).

param.name: items[].zoomTop
param.description: Top coordinate of the displayed window inside the camera image, as a fraction of the image height (floating-point, 0..1).

param.name: items[].zoomRight
param.description: Right coordinate of the displayed window inside the camera image, as a fraction of the image width (floating-point, 0..1).

param.name: items[].zoomBottom
param.description: Bottom coordinate of the displayed window inside the camera image, as a fraction of the image width (floating-point, 0..1).

param.name: items[].zoomTargetId
param.description: Unique id of the original layout item for which the zoom window was created.

param.name: items[].contrastParams
param.description: Image enhancement parameters. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

param.name: items[].dewarpingParams
param.description: Image dewarping parameters. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

param.name: items[].displayInfo
param.description: Whether to display info for the layout item.

param.name: locked
param.description: Whether the layout is locked.

param.name: backgroundWidth
param.description: Width of the background image in pixels (integer).

param.name: backgroundHeight
param.description: Height of the background image in pixels (integer).

param.name: backgroundOpacity
param.description: Level of opacity of the background image in pixels (floating-point 0..1).

function.name: saveStorage
function.description:
Save the storage.
Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

param.name: id
param.description: Storage unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object.

param.name: parentId
param.description: Parent server unique id.

param.name: name
param.description: Might be empty.

param.name: url
param.description: Must be full storage url (path to the local folder).

param.name: spaceLimit
param.description: Free space to maintain on the storage, in bytes. Recommended value is 10 gigabytes for local storages and 100 gigabytes for NAS.

param.name: usedForWriting
param.description: Whether writing to the storage is allowed.

param.name: storageType
param.description: Type of the method to access the storage.

param.name: addParams
param.description: List of storage additional parameters. Intended for internal use; leave empty when creating a new storage.

param.name: isBackup
param.description: Whether the storage is used for backup.

description.p: Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

param.name: id
param.description: User unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

param.name: parentId
param.description: Should be empty.

param.name: name
param.description: User name.

param.name: url
param.description: Should be empty.

param.name: typeId
param.description: Should have fixed value.

param.name: isAdmin
param.description: Indended for internal use; keep the value when saving a previously received object, use false when creating a new one.

param.name: permissions
param.description: Combination (via "|") of the following flags:

value.name: GlobalViewArchivePermission
value.description: Can view archives of available cameras.

value.name: GlobalExportPermission
value.description: Can export archives of available cameras.

value.name: GlobalViewBookmarksPermission
value.description: Can view bookmarks of available cameras.

value.name: GlobalManageBookmarksPermission
value.description: Can modify bookmarks of available cameras.

value.name: GlobalUserInputPermission
value.description: Can change PTZ state of a camera, use 2-way audio, I/O buttons.

value.name: GlobalAccessAllMediaPermission
value.description: Has access to all media (cameras and web pages).

value.name: GlobalCustomUserPermission
value.description: Flag: this user has custom permissions

param.name: userRoleId
param.description: User role unique id.

param.name: email
param.description: User's email.

param.name: digest
param.description: HA1 digest hash from user password, as per RFC 2069. When modifying an existing user, supply empty string. When creating a new user, calculate the value based on UTF-8 password as follows: digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password);

param.name: hash
cryptSha512Hash
param.description: Cryptography key hash. Supply empty string when creating, keep the value when modifying.

param.name: realm
param.description: HTTP authorization realm as defined in RFC 2617, can be obtained via /api/gettime.

param.name: isLdap
param.description: Whether the user was imported from LDAP.

param.name: isEnabled
param.description: Whether the user is enabled.

param.name: isCloud
param.description: Whether the user is a cloud user, as opposed to a local one.

param.name: fullName
param.description: Full name of the user.

value.description: Can view bookmarks of available cameras.

function.name: saveUsers
function.description:
Saves the list of users. Only local and LDAP users are supported. Cloud users won't be saved.
Parameters should be passed as a JSON array of objects in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

param.name: id
param.description: User unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

param.name: parentId
param.description: Should be empty.

param.name: name
param.description: User name.

param.name: url
param.description: Should be empty.

param.name: typeId
param.description: Should have fixed value.

param.name: isAdmin
param.description: Indended for internal use; keep the value when saving a previously received object, use false when creating a new one.

param.name: permissions
param.description: Combination (via "|") of the following flags:

value.name: GlobalViewArchivePermission
value.description: Can view archives of available cameras.

value.name: GlobalExportPermission

value.name: GlobalViewBookmarksPermission
value.description: Can view bookmarks of available cameras.

value.name: GlobalManageBookmarksPermission

value.name: GlobalUserInputPermission
value.description: Can change PTZ state of a camera, use 2-way audio, I/O buttons.

value.name: GlobalAccessAllMediaPermission
value.description: Has access to all media (cameras and web pages).

value.name: GlobalCustomUserPermission
value.description: Flag: this user has custom permissions

param.name: userRoleId
param.description: User role unique id.

param.name: email
param.description: User's email.

param.name: digest
param.description: HA1 digest hash from user password, as per RFC 2069. When modifying an existing user, supply empty string. When creating a new user, calculate the value based on UTF-8 password as follows: digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password);

param.name: hash
cryptSha512Hash
param.description: Cryptography key hash. Supply empty string when creating, keep the value when modifying.

param.name: realm
param.description: HTTP authorization realm as defined in RFC 2617, can be obtained via /api/gettime.

param.name: isLdap
param.description: Whether the user was imported from LDAP.

param.name: isEnabled
param.description: Whether the user is enabled.

param.name: isCloud
param.description: Whether the user is a cloud user, as opposed to a local one.

param.name: fullName
param.description: Full name of the user.

function.name: createEvent
function.description:
Using this method it is possible to trigger a generic event in the system from a 3rd party system. Such event will be handled and logged according to current event rules. Parameters of the generated event, such as "source", "caption" and "description", are intended to be analyzed by these rules.
Example:
http://127.0.0.1:7001/api/createEvent?timestamp=2016-09-16T16:02:41Z&caption=CreditCardUsed&metadata={"cameraRefs":["3A4AD4EA-9269-4B1F-A7AA-2CEC537D0248","3A4AD4EA-9269-4B1F-A7AA-2CEC537D0240"]}
This example triggers a generic event informing the system that a credit card has been used on September 16, 2016 at 16:03:41 UTC in a POS terminal being watched by the two specified cameras.

param.name: timestamp
param.description: Event date and time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). If "timestamp" is absent, the current server date and time is used.

param.name: source
param.description: Name of the device which has triggered the event. It can be used in a filter in event rules to assign different actions to different devices. Also, the user could see this name in the notifications panel. Example: "POS terminal 5".

param.name: caption
param.description: Short event description. It can be used in a filter in event rules to assign actions depending on this text.

param.name: description
param.description: Long event description. It can be used as a filter in event rules to assign actions depending on this text.

param.name: metadata
param.description:
Additional information associated with the event, in the form of a JSON object. Currently this object can specify the only field "cameraRefs", but other fields could be added in the future.
"cameraRefs" specifies a number of cameras which are linked to the event (e.g. the event will appear on their timelines), in the form of a list of camera ids (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting).

param.name: state
param.description: Generic events can be used either with "long" actions like "do recording", or instant actions like "send email". This parameter should be specified in case "long" actions are going to be used with generic events.

value.name: Active
value.description: Generic event is considered a "long" event. It transits to the "active" state. "Long" actions will continue executing until the generic event transits to the "inactive" state.

value.name: Inactive
value.description: A "long" action associated with this generic event in event rules will stop.

result.caption: JSON result with error code.

function.name: mergeSystems
function.description:
Merge two Systems.
The System that joins another System is called the current System, the joinable System is called the target System. The URL parameter sets the target Server which should be joined with the current System. Other servers, that are merged with the target Server will be joined if parameter mergeOneServer is set to false.
The method uses digest authentication. Two hashes should be previouly calculated: getKey and postKey. Both are mandatory. The calculation algorithm is described in Calculating authentication hash section (in the bootom of the page). While calculating hashes, username and password of the target Server are needed. Digest authentication needs realm and nonce, both can be obtained with GET /api/getNonce call call. The lifetime of a nonce is about a few minutes.

param.name: url
param.description: URL of one Server in the System to join.

param.name: getKey
param.description: Authentication hash of the target Server for GET requests.

param.name: postKey
param.description: Authentication hash of the target Server for POST requests.

param.name: takeRemoteSettings
param.description: Direction of the merge. Default value is false. If mergeOneServer is true, takeRemoteSettings parameter is ignored and treated as false.

value.name: true
value.description: The current system will get system name and administrator password of the target system.

value.name: false
value.description: The target system will get system name and administrator password of the current system.

param.name: mergeOneServer
param.description: Whether to merge with servers merged with the target server. Default value is false. If mergeOneServer is set to true, takeRemoteSettings is ignored and treated as false.

value.name: true
value.description: The current system will merge with target server only. The target server will be disjoined from another system (if it was joined).

value.name: false
value.description: The current system will merge with target server and all servers which are merged with the target server.

param.name: ignoreIncompatible
param.description: Whether to ignore different version of merged server protocols. Default value is false.

value.name: false
value.description: If the target server protocol version differs from the current server protocol version merge aborts.

result.caption: JSON with error code and error string. Error string could be empty in case of successful ping, "FAIL" if the specified system is unreachable or there is no system, "UNAUTHORIZED" if the authentication credentials are invalid, "INCOMPATIBLE" if the found system has incompatible version or different customization, and "BACKUP_ERROR" if database backup could not been created.

function.name: ptz
function.description: Perform reading or writing PTZ operation

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: command
param.description: PTZ operation

value.name: ContinuousMovePtzCommand
value.description: Start PTZ continues move. Parameters xSpeed, ySpeed and zSpeed are used in range [-1.0..+1.0]. To stop moving use value 0 for all parameters.

value.name: ContinuousFocusPtzCommand
value.description: Start PTZ focus in or out. Parameter speed defines speed and focus direction in range [-1.0..+1.0].

value.name: AbsoluteDeviceMovePtzCommand
value.description: Move camera to absolute position. Parameters xPos, yPos and zPos are used in range defined by camera. Parameter speed is used in range [0..1.0].

value.name: AbsoluteLogicalMovePtzCommand
value.description: Move camera to absolute position. Parameters xPos, yPos range are: [-180..+180]. Parameter zPos range is: [0..180] (field of view in degree). Parameters speed range is: [0..1.0].

value.name: GetDevicePositionPtzCommand
value.description: Read camera current position. Return parameters xPos, yPos and zPos in range defined by camera.

value.name: GetLogicalPositionPtzCommand
value.description: Read camera current position. Return parameters xPos, yPos in range [-180..+180]. Return parameter zPos in range [0..180] (field of view in degree).

value.name: CreatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Create PTZ preset. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter presetName defines display preset name.

value.name: UpdatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Update PTZ preset display name. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter presetName defines display preset name.

value.name: RemovePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Update PTZ preset display name. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name

value.name: ActivatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Go to PTZ preset. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter speed defines move speed in range [0..1.0.]

result.caption: JSON object with an error code (0 means OK) and error message.

function.name: rebuildArchive
function.description: Start or stop the server archive rebuilding, also can report this process status.

param.name: action
param.description: What to do and what to report about the server archive rebuild.

param.name: mainPool
param.description: 1 (for the main storage) or 0 (for the backup storage)

result.caption: Rebuild progress status or an error code.

function.name: restart
function.description: Restarts the server.

result.caption: JSON with error code.

function.name: restoreState
function.description: Restore server state to default. Cleans database and system name.

param.name: oldPassword
param.description: Current admin password

result.caption: JSON result with an error code and an error string.

function.name: saveCloudSystemCredentials
function.description: Sets or resets cloud credentials (systemId and authorization key) to be used by system

value.name: true
value.description: If specified, removes cloud credentials from DB. System will not connect to cloud anymore

function.name: scriptList
function.description: Return list of scripts to execute.

result.caption: JSON object with string list.

function.name: setCameraParam
function.description: Sets values of several camera parameters. This parameters are used on the Advanced tab in camera settings. For instance: brightness, contrast e.t.c.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: <any_name>
param.description: Parameter for camera to set. Request can contain one or more parameters to set.

result.caption: "OK" if all parameters have been set, otherwise return error 500 (Internal server error) and the result of setting for every parameter.

function.name: setTime

param.name: timeZoneId
param.description: Time zone identifier, can be obtained via /api/getTimeZones.

param.name: dateTime
param.description: Date and time (as string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

function.name: settime
function.description: Set current time on the server machine. Can be called only if server flags include "SF_timeCtrl" (server flags can be obtained via /ec2/getMediaServersEx in "flags" field).

param.name: timezone
param.description: Time zone identifier, can be obtained via /api/getTimeZones.

param.name: datetime
param.description: System date and time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

function.name: setupCloudSystem
function.description: Configure server system name and attach it to cloud. This function can be called for server with default system name. Otherwise function returns error. This method requires owner permissions.

param.name: systemName
param.description: New system name

param.name: cloudAuthKey
param.description: could authentication key

param.name: cloudSystemID
param.description: could system id

result.caption: JSON result with error code

function.name: setupLocalSystem
function.description: Configure server system name and password. This function can be called for server with default system name. Otherwise function returns error. This method requires owner permissions.

param.name: password
param.description: New password for admin user

param.name: systemName
param.description: New system name

result.caption: JSON result with error code

function.name: showLog
function.description: Return tail of the server log file

param.name: lines
param.description: Display last N log lines.

param.name: id
param.description: Id of log file. By default main log is returned

result.caption: Tail of the server log file in text format

function.name: statistics
function.description: Return server info: CPU usage, HDD usage e.t.c.

result.caption: JSON data with statistics.

function.name: storageSpace
function.description: Return a list of all server storages.

result.caption: JSON data with server storages.

function.name: storageStatus
function.description: Check if specified folder can be used as a server storage.

param.name: path
param.description: Folder to check.

result.caption: JSON data. "OK" if specified folder may be used for writing on the server. Otherwise returns "FAIL"

function.name: systemSettings
function.description: Get or set global system settings. If called with no arguments, just returns list of all system settings with their values

param.name: <param_name>
param.description: name of system parameter. E.g., ec2AliveUpdateIntervalSec

param.name: <param_value>
param.description: New value for the specified parameter

group.groupDescription: This group contains information about accessing cameras" live video and footage.

function.name: <cameraId>
function.caption: RTSP Streaming
function.description: Open RTSP video stream from a camera. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). Example: rtsp://<server_ip>:<port>/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p

param.name: pos
param.description: By default, the server opens a camera at the live position. This parameter defines position in an archive (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). Position can be passed via standard RTSP attribute as well as via URL parameter

param.name: resolution
param.description: Turn on video transcoding to the specified resolution. Resolution string either may contain width and height (for instance 320x240) or height only (for instance 240p)

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog. Parameter take place if video transcoding is activated (parameter codec and/or parameter resolution are presents.)

param.name: codec
param.description: Defines video codec used for transcoding. Default value is H263.

param.name: stream
param.description: Open high quality stream if parameter is 0 or low quality stream if parameter is 1. By default server auto detect preferred stream index based on destination resolution.

param.name: speed
param.description: Playback speed. Only values in range [1..32] are supported. Default value is 1.

result.caption: RTSP video stream.

function.name: media/<cameraId>.<format>
function.caption: HTTP Streaming
function.description: Open HTTP video stream from a camera. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). Codec and stream format can be specified in URL parameters. Live stream and archive can be downloaded. If required and possible, media stream transcoding is performed on-the-fly. Stream format can be one of the following: webm, mpegts, mpjpeg (motion jpeg). Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/media/12AB42FD5912.webm

param.name: resolution
param.description: Video stream resolution. Example: 720x576, 1920x1080, 720p, 1080p. By default, 640x480 is used

param.name: pos
param.description: If present and not equal to <now>, specifies archive stream start position (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). Otherwise, LIVE stream is provided

param.name: endPos
param.description: If present, specifies archive stream end position (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). It is used only if "pos" parameter is present.

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog.

param.name: sfd
param.description: Stand Frame Duration. If the parameter is present, video speed is limited by real time.

param.name: rt
param.description: Turn on realtime optimization. It will drop some frames if not enough CPU for realtime transcoding.

result.caption: Video stream in the requested format

function.name: hls/<cameraId>.m3u
function.caption: HLS Streaming
function.description: Open HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) video stream from a camera. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). This protocol is supported by iOS-based devices (iPhone, iPad). Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.m3u

param.name: pos
param.description: Camera archive position to open (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

param.name: hi
param.description: If specified, only hi quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

param.name: lo
param.description: If specified, only low quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

result.caption: Video stream in mpeg-2/ts format

function.name: hls/<cameraId>.<format>
function.caption: Direct download
function.description: Download fragment of a camera archive, identified by its start time and duration. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). Fragment can be downloaded in mpeg-2/ts (.ts) or Matroska (.mkv) format. No transcoding is performed. Stream format can be one of following: ts, mkv. Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.mkv?startDatetime=2015-02-05T19:00&duration=10

param.name: pos
param.description: Fragment start time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

param.name: duration
param.description: Fragment length in seconds

param.name: hi
param.description: Return high quality stream

param.name: lo
param.description: Return low quality stream

result.caption: Video stream in the requested format

group.groupDescription: This group contains information requests proxy from one server to another.

function.name: <protocol>/<serverGuid>/<apiRequest>
function.description: Proxy methods allows to send any request to any server using the existing public connection. Can also be used to get video streams. Example: rtsp://10.0.2.1/proxy/rtsp/{72934575-ceb7-54bb-23a0-84b81cf1d3f1}/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p Example: http://10.0.2.1/proxy/http/{72934575-ceb7-54bb-23a0-84b81cf1d3f1}/showLog

result.caption: Result of the target API request.

group.groupDescription: Request authentication methods supported by server.

function.name: HTTP Basic/Digest authentication
function.description:
This method is preferable for external applications, most of HTTP libraries support it.
Server is fully conformant with the authentication defined in rfc2617 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617).

function.name: Cookie-based authentication
function.description:
This method should only be used in browser javascript applications.
Cookie authorization scheme allows to avoid standard login/password dialog in web-applications.
It provides you a way to replace it with your own dialog.
It works mostly like sessions, but is a bit more secure because it doesn't send user's password over HTTP.
To check authentication:
Call GET /api/getCurrentUser
You will get 401 (Unauthorised) in case you need authorization
You will get 200 (OK) and the user object otherwise
To log in:
Call GET /api/getNonce
In response you'll get a JSON object with realm and nonce (nonce is a session key for this user)
Calculate authentication hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
Call POST /api/cookieLogin and pass the "auth" parameter in the json request body
Server will check authentication and set session cookies
Executing requests:
Session cookie should be supplied with every request, browser does it automatically if cookies are enabled
HTTP header Nx-Vms-Csrf-Token should contain the key from nx-vms-csrf-token cookie value
To log out:
Call POST /api/cookieLogout
Server will clear the session cookies

function.name: URL-based authentication
function.description:
This method should only be used if other methods are not applicable, e.g. webm direct link.
Add the "auth" parameter to the URL query section of any GET request
Call /api/getNonce to get realm and nonce from the server (the current server time is used as a nonce value, and the nonce is valid for about 5 minutes)
Calculate the authentication hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
Specify the authentication hash in the URL parameter: http://127.0.0.1:7001/method?auth=auth_digest&other_params

function.name: Calculating authentication hash
function.description:
For URL-based authentication and cookie-based authentication you need to calculate the hash manually, using the following algorithm:
Call GET /api/getNonce
In response you'll get a JSON object with realm and nonce
Translate user's username to the lower case
Check the required method ("GET" for HTTP GET requests, "POST" for HTTP POST requests, "PLAY" for RTSP etc)
digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password)
partial_ha2 = md5_hex(method + ":")
simplified_ha2 = md5_hex(digest + ":" + nonce + ":" + partial_ha2)
auth_digest = base64(user_name + ":" + nonce + ":" + simplified_ha2)
Here auth_digest is the required authentication hash
